recipe_name: Mussel, chilli and basil linguine with turmeric cream sauce
author: Alex Mackay
method: For the pasta, heat the olive oil in a pan and gently fry the garlic and chilli for 1-2 minutes, or until softened. Stir in the cooked pasta and mussels and heat through for 4-5 minutes, then stir in the parsley. Keep warm. For the turmeric cream sauce, heat the olive oil in a pan and gently fry the garlic and turmeric for 1-2 minutes, or until softened. Add the stock and simmer for 5-6 minutes, or until the liquid has reduced by half. Stir in the cream and bring to a simmer for 2-3 minutes to warm through.  For the herb pesto, place all of the pesto ingredients into a food processor and pulse until smooth. To serve, stir the pasta into the cream sauce and place into a serving bowl. Drizzle the pesto over the top and serve immediately.
ingredients: 1 tbsp olive oil,  1 garlic clove, crushed,  ½ red chilli, finely chopped,  250g/9oz dried linguine, cooked according to packet instructions, drained,  6 mussels, cooked and in their shells (discard any mussels that haven't opened during cooking),  2 tbsp chopped fresh parsley,  1 tbsp olive oil,  1 garlic clove, crushed,  ½ tsp ground turmeric,  50ml/2fl oz vegetable stock,  100ml/3½fl oz double cream,  1 small handful fresh basil ,  1 small handful fresh parsley,  4 tbsp olive oil,  salt and freshly ground black pepper
